recordings.loc: Gedser Odde, Gedser Point, most southern point of Scandinavia
recordings.rmk:
Two types of calls  present - but very short sequence - first a fast "quid-quid" then the typical harsh call.
The species is possible extinct from the area but hunters have re-introduced the species (though not sure if it is the same subspecies - likely not).
The call as I have understood is part of or very like the song so not sure what to put here (call or song).

recordings.loc: San Marcello Piteglio, Provincia di Pistoia, Toscana
recordings.type: flight call, life stage uncertain, sex uncertain
recordings.rmk:
Good evening,
I would like your opinion on this verse recorded Sunday on the path 66 CAI that leads to the Scaffaiolo's lake  (PT) N_Appennine, to 1670 mslm. Unfortunately I was immersed in the clouds and the temperature was around -8 °C. Strong frosty gusts. I have my own idea, but I would like to read other opinions. Thanks

recordings.file-name: XC112600-Grey Partridge Calls - Ada Co Idaho.mp3
recordings.rmk:
Grey (Gray) Partridge is not a native species in North America, but have well established populations are are "countable" by those playing the listing game.

The habitat was foothills, sage brush steppe north of Boise, Idaho. The Gray Partridges are commonly seen in this area feeding along the slopes.
Poor recording into gusty wind and recorded on a golf course with the noise of a ride on mower nearby
